overall_summary: The reasoning process focused on handling short historical data (96 hourly points) with daily seasonality by employing a simple yet effective averaging approach. The analysis demonstrated careful consideration of method limitations (SARIMA/ETS requiring more data) and opted for hourly averaging across 4 days to create a daily profile forecast. The approach prioritized robustness over complexity given data constraints.
common_data_patterns: Complete data without missing values in provided history
key_insights: Hourly averaging compensates for limited historical data while capturing daily patterns
Explicit check for trends/anomalies before selecting methodology
Consideration and rejection of complex models (SARIMA/ETS) due to short data length
Rigorous hourly mean calculations with precision management (3 decimal rounding)
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with thorough evaluation of multiple methodologies before selecting a heuristic approach. Included detailed data pattern examination and precision considerations while maintaining practical implementation focus.
